title: My Dear Brother Tony
author: Pratibha Ahuja (Kuki)
content:
Two months have passed, but the pain of your absence remains as fresh as ever. You were not just my brother, you were my strength, my protector, my friend. A soul so kind, generous, and full of love- you truly embodied what it means to be human.

There are so many beautiful memories of you, moments of laughter, support, and quiet understanding that words can never fully capture. You were a blessing in our lives and your absence is a void we feel deeply.

You stood by me like a pillar through every sorrow, especially when I lost my husband, and celebrated every joy with me, as if it were your own. Your comforting words, warm presence and unwavering support are etched in my heart forever.

You lived not just for yourself but for others- always reaching out, always ready to help, always spreading light wherever you went. The world feels a little colder without your smile, but your spirit lives on in every life you touched.

May your noble soul rest in eternal peace. You will be forever missed.

Pratibha Ahuja (Kuki) Cousin Sister

title: Jai Shri Ram Bhaiya
author: Poonam (Mumbai)
content:
जय श्रीराम भैया, मेरी शादी से पहले मेरा कोई बड़ा भाई नहीं था, और शादी होते ही जैसे मुझे आप में एक सच्चा बड़ा भाई मिल गया। आपने मेरे बड़े भाई की कमी पूरी कर दी। आपसे मुझे हमेशा इतना स्नेह और समर्थन मिला है कि मैं पूरे दिल से कह सकती हूँ- मेरी शादी से लेकर अक्षय की शादी तक, जितना साथ आपने दिया, उतना किसी और ने नहीं दिया।

यहाँ तक कि जब हमें सपोर्ट की ज़रूरत नहीं भी थी, तब भी आप हमेशा हमारे साथ खड़े रहे। आपने हम सबको, खासकर पूरे परिवार को, जितनी सकारात्मकता दी है, वह अमूल्य है।

विशेषकर कोविड के समय, जब आपने ज़ूम कॉल पर सुंदरकांड का पाठ शुरू किया, तो पूरे परिवार को एक सूत्र में बाँध कर रखा। वह एक बेहद खूबसूरत और सशक्त पहल थी, जिसने मुश्किल समय में हम सबको जोड़े रखा।

भजन गाने की प्रेरणा भी मुझे आपसे ही मिली। उससे पहले तो मैंने कभी भजन गाने की हिम्मत नहीं की थी, लेकिन आपकी वजह से वह भी सम्भव हो पाया। आपके स्नेह और प्रेरणा ने मुझे कई स्तरों पर निखारा है।

आप हमारे परिवार के उस धागे की तरह हैं जिसमें हम सब मोतियों की तरह पिरोए हुए हैं। वो सूत्र जो सबको जोड़ कर रखता है- वही आप हैं, भैया। हमें हमेशा ऐसे ही जोड़ कर रखने की प्रेरणा देते रहिए।

थैंक यू सो मच फॉर एवरीथिंग, भैया। जैसे रहे हैं, वैसे ही हमेशा हमारे साथ बने रहिए।

title: Mere Pyare Tony Bhai!
author: आपका भिंडी, आपका भाई पिंकी
content:
मेरे प्यारे टोनी भाई ! आप क्या चले गए, इस ज़िंदगी से रौनक ही चली गई। मुझे तो यह समझ में नहीं आ रहा कि मैं आपको किस रूप में याद करें- अपने भाई के रूप में, एक दोस्त के रूप में, एक राज़दार के रूप में, एक पितृभक्त के रूप में, या एक फैमिली मैन के रूप में।

बच्चों को अच्छी शिक्षा देने वाले, उन्हें तरक्की की राह पर ले जाने वाले इंसान के रूप में याद करूं, या उस इंसान के रूप में, जो अपनी पत्नी को हर समय इतना प्यार करता था। या फिर उस रूप में, जिसने पूरे परिवार को एक तरह से बांधकर रखा था।

जितनी बार मैं सोचता हूँ, उतनी बार एक नया रूप सामने आता है। लेकिन सबसे ऊपर अगर मैं आपको मानता हूँ, तो एक परम भक्त के रूप में।

We need to celebrate your life - every day in and every day out. Because only if we celebrate your life, you will be happy wherever you are.

तो मेरे भाईजान, जहां भी हो, जैसे भी हो- अपनी मुस्कान, अपना आशीर्वाद हम पर बनाए रखना, बरसाते रहना। जय श्री राम, जय श्री हनुमान, जय बजरंग बली की जय।

आपका भिंडी, आपका भाई पिंकी

title: The Adventures of Petha and Mufali
author: K. K. Aggarwal (Bittoo)
content:
In 1970s, while preparing for my 12th Board exams- during two months of study leave, I stayed at JK Bhaiya's home in Titarpur. That's where I met Tony, and we became close friends. Being January winters and my sweet tooth, he started calling me PETHA. He loved peanuts, so I called him MUFALI.

MUFALI was emotional and kindhearted. He'd see me studying from morning to night, locked in a room. In the evening, he'd often request (or beg) Bhaiya to let me take a break. Really, it was for both of us, to unwind and occasionally birdwatch in Rajouri Garden! Pinky sometimes joined us on these fun little outings.

MUFALI also had a great appetite and loved street food. Being with him, I became a foodie too. Those were beautiful days, etched in my soul. They say you can take away wealth and property, but not memories.

TONY was not only emotional and kindhearted but also an HONEST and GOD-fearing Ram Bhagat. I was reminded of him just last week when I went to drop a friend at New Delhi Railway Station - Ajmeri Gate side. It brought back a memory of an incident from there that still gives me goosebumps.

Tony was once crossing the flyover from Paharganj to Ajmeri Gate. At the end of the flyover, he saw a crowd around an old man sitting on the pavement. After passing the crowd, he noticed a red cloth on the road. He stopped his blue Vespa scooter, picked up the cloth, and opened it, it was a gold bar. He understood what had happened. He quietly put it in his pocket and approached the old man to inquire.

The man said, "Bas samjho meri zindagi ki kamai kho gayi. Ab mere paas marne ke alawa koi raasta nahi hai."

And just like that, our Ram Bhagat, our honest and pure soul gave the man his assets back. He asked for nothing in return except blessings, which meant far more to him than money ever could.

Think about it. Close your eyes. Would we be able to let go of something worth 10 lakh rupees in today's world, especially while still struggling in life? I say this as an advocate who deals with money matters daily where money is often valued more than relationships and honesty.

GREAT TONY, WE ARE PROUD OF YOU. TONY, I CAN FEEL YOU SMILING BESIDE ME. YOU WILL BE IN OUR HEARTS FOREVER

title: A Bond Beyond Blood - Part 1
author: Arvind Mittal
content:
Today, I speak from the depths of my heart about a man who was more than just a part of my life, he shaped it in many ways. GK Batra, whom we lovingly called Tony Bhaiya, wasn't just my elder brother in spirit, he was also my closest friend, my trusted advisor, and my emotional anchor since the year 1980.

It is rare to find someone who becomes an integral part of your family and your soul, not because of shared blood, but because of shared love, mutual respect, and unwavering presence. From the very beginning of our association, Tony Bhaiya radiated something special. He lived with a grace that made him stand out, yet remained grounded with humility that made him so loved.

In every interaction, in every gesture, there was sincerity, kindness, and a rare sense of presence. He wasn't just there he truly cared. His qualities weren't performative they were his essence. For him, love, regard, and respect weren't social expectations they were his way of life.

title: A Bond Beyond Blood - Part 2: The Memory Keeper
author: Arvind Mittal
content:
Tony Bhaiya was the epitome of a thorough gentleman, not in a superficial or formal sense, but in the truest, most heartfelt way. He treated every person he came across with dignity, whether it was family, friends, or acquaintances. His aura commanded warmth and his smile disarmed even the most distant hearts.

One of Tony Bhaiya's most extraordinary and touching qualities was his astonishing memory, not just of facts or events, but of people's moments. He remembered everyone's birthdays and wedding anniversaries, not just for one age group or a handful of people, but across generations and extended families. He made sure to call, message, or personally remind others of those dates.

In a world where many forget even their own commitments, Tony Bhaiya was the one who remembered us. He remembered what mattered to us. His calendar wasn't marked by holidays, it was filled with hearts. And he celebrated these occasions not as formalities, but with genuine emotion. He kept alive the ties between people, reminding us that relationships matter, that every person matters.

title: A Bridge of Hearts
author: Shaikh Bashir Ahmed
content:
It's hard to believe he is no longer among us. Batra ji was not just a friend: he was like a brother, family in every sense of the word. In a world so often divided by religion and background, he was a living bridge of love, unity, and understanding. I follow Islam, and he was a Hindu, yet we never saw differences. Instead, we found common ground in humanity, kindness, and mutual respect. In our faith, we call such a person a farishta (an angel) and that is exactly what he was.

One of my most cherished memories is from 2008, when Batra ji visited Kashmir for the Amarnath Yatra. Despite the crowds and chaos, he came straight from Srinagar Airport to our home with his friends. We shared meals, stories, and unforgettable moments. Due to heavy traffic, we decided to take a helicopter for the yatra. Upon returning, we hosted a traditional Kashmiri lunch with a dastarkhan, copper utensils, and kehwa tea. He was fascinated by our culture, comparing it to Iran, and expressed heartfelt joy at the experience.

When he returned from the pilgrimage, he brought back prasad for us, saying he had prayed for my family. In his final days, when I learned from a friend that he had been hospitalised, I quickly called him. Though his voice was faint, he still had that same kindness. Even in illness his thoughts were with others, with us.

title: TONY-ISM a love for food...
author: Divya
content:
Papa had such a love for good food... something that brought him immense happiness always. From chole bhature with his BFFs, to dahi bhalle with his cousins, to paneer pakode with his girlfriend, to vada pav with Nikesh and me - he was a foodie to the core.

In 2001, after his stroke, that love took a different shape. He got serious about his health and stuck to it. Dinner became ghiya, tori and petha for months... maybe even years.

But his love for food never left - it just transformed. From eating to feeding. It became his love language. Even when he wasn't eating much himself, he found joy in making sure that others were enjoying the best options available.

That was his way of loving... thoughtful, inventive, and full of heart.

title: ... and a love for Feeding!
author: Divya
content:
If he was sharing a sweet, and someone would refuse saying they don't eat meetha (sugar), he would often tell them, "yeh thodi meethe mein count hota hai!" followed by putting a chunk of boondi / laddu / barfi in their hand!

यदि वह कोई मिठाई बांट रहे होते और कोई यह कहकर मना कर देता कि वे मीठा नहीं खाते, तो वह अक्सर उनसे कहते, "ये थोड़े मीठे में काउंट होता है!" और उसके बाद उनके हाथ में बूंदी / लड्डू / बर्फी का एक टुकड़ा रख देते !

title: Tony's Kitchen
author: Editorial
content:
Bring Tony's favorite flavors to a kitchen near you.

His love for food and feeding is no suprise to anyone who knew him. What very few knew was that he was quite particular about how he liked some of his favorite items. For instance, the way the tea bag needs to mix with the water before the '2 spoons' of milk comes in. Like the baingan bharta needs to be had with the first thick slice of bread fresh from the packet. Here we try to share with you how to make some of his favorite foods, just how he loved them.

title: Dry Fruit Namkeen "Mixture"
author: Editorial
content:
Ingredients:
• Nuts: Cashews, Almonds, Pistachios, Walnuts
• Seeds: Sunflower seeds, Pumpkin seeds
• Flax seeds
• 2-3 tsp desi ghee (or to your taste)
• His secret twist: a sprinkle of amchoor or anardana

Method (Just How He Did)
He'd spend 10-15 minutes dry roasting each nut on its own- cashews first, then almonds, pistachios, and walnuts- rather than tossing them all in one pan. Whenever mumma asked him, "Why spend so much time?" he'd say, "They'll steal each other's flavor if I mix them now."

title: "laddu sehat wala"
author: Editorial
content:
Ingredients:
• 1 heaped cup soft black dates (pitted) - use Medjool or the sticky kind
• 1¼ cup almonds

Sabse pehle- Dry fruits ko ghee mein halka sa bhun lo. Not too dark, just till the smell tells you they're yummy. Set them aside.

Dates ko mixer mein daal do, make a thick, sticky paste. No water, just pulse till it comes together.

title: besan barfi
author: Editorial
content:
Ingredients
• 1/2 cup chana dal (bengal gram) - roast it well
• 3-4 green cardamoms - for warmth

First, dry roast the chana dal with the cardamom. Medium flame. Let it turn golden and smell a bit toasty - not burnt, just right.

Let it cool. Then grind it - not too fine, not too coarse. You'll know when it feels right.

title: Baingan ka Bharta - His Favorite

title: Tony, the Elephant King (A tale from Shalimar Bagh)
author: Atul Vasudeva
content:
Once upon a time, in the urban jungle of Delhi's Shalimar Bagh, lived a gentle giant named Gajender, the Elephant King! But those who knew him well just called him Tony.

Tony wasn't like other giants. His frame was compact, but his hunger made him a giant. Not a hunger for food, but a hunger to feed people. Yes, Tony had a very special power, he loved feeding others. Not just anyone, but especially children. And he did it with love, the kind often seen in mothers and grandmothers.

When I first met Tony, I was a little scared. All the kids were. He had such a big appetite, to love, to feed, to give. But slowly, he drew me in. He'd call me to his den, and I'd try to say no. "But I just had food..." "I have food at home..." Tony didn't care. He believed something special: "Stomachs are made of infinite elastic!"

One day, Tony disappeared. No goodbies. No farewell feast. Just... gone.

They say he passed on to another dimension. I like to believe he's out there, in some magical world, still feeding children, still smiling, still offering 1+1 on all things delicious. His reign of tasty terror lives on... just in another realm.

title: Tony Nana
author: Aaradhya Kaistha
content:
Tony Nana is the best Nana ever. He's really really kind, and he's, like, always prepared. Like, he always has stuff to give us as his granddaughters and grandsons.

He is also really fun. He jokes around really nicely, and he was always nice to me, and to Ahaana, no matter what. All the time.

He really cared about everyone! Just the emptiness in my heart will never go away.

title: DEAR, TONY NANU,
author: Dev Arora
content:
You have done very good and helpful Things to us & taught us to be helpful, kind & meny other thing. Your memory will always be in our hearts. we all miss you.

I Remember the time when we were eating chocolates and no one had seen us. WE AAL LOVE YOU.

title: PEOPLE SHOULD ALWAYS REMEMBER THAT HE WAS VERY VERY KIND AND HE ALWAYS HELPED OTHERS NO MATTER WHAT!!
author: Eshika Chopra
content:
Chachu Nanu was always showing us unconditional love. He was always buying us gifts, getting us food, always getting us what we wanted... even when we did something bad like breaking something.

His strength and weakness were actually the same!! His strength was helping people... but his weakness was also helping people. (when asked to explain.) "It was nice of him to help. But sometimes if you help people a bit too much, then they can get greedy."

title: Dear Tony Nanu,
author: Khushi Arora
content: even if you are with god. You make every one happy. You are the best Nanu in the whole universe. I will remember you forever. Thank you for giving me the drawing gift. Love, Khushi

title: A WORLD MADE BETTER BY TONY CHACHU
author: Suhaani Chopra
content:
What stood out the most to me about Tony Chachu was his unconditional love, his love for food, and even more, his love for feeding others, which was truly special. But beyond that, it was his generosity of heart that stayed with everyone who met him.

Feeding people wasn't just something he did, it was who he was. He always made sure everyone else had eaten before thinking of himself. Every time he came to our house, I knew I'd have good food to eat for the rest of the week, because he used to bring so much. And I knew it was always going to be good food.

He had such a warm personality and treated everybody the same way, with such love, that everybody remembered him more than anyone else they had met. One of the clearest visuals I have of him is of him walking into our home with his arms full of bags and packets, his hands full and his heart fuller. That's how I will always remember him.

His greatest strength was the relationships he created, just by being the person that he was. Anything and everything you needed, Tony Chachu had a contact for. Because he just knew so many people. And people, willingly, without any reason or expectation, wanted to do things for him. Because he was just that person.

What I will always carry with me is this: every time I catch myself being egoistic or mean towards someone... I feel like I should take a step back and try to view the world the way Tony Chachu did where there is good in everybody.

It's just... the world was a better place with him in it, that's how I felt. And I feel like... by the end of my life, if I can be even ten percent of who he was, then I'll know that I've made a difference. Because he did. To so many people. To me.

title: EPILOGUE
author: Divya Batra Masiwal
content:
Now to you, the readers, the contributors, and everyone flipping through these pages - Thank you. By reading this, by carrying a bit of him with you, you're keeping my father close... and that means more than words can express.

And look at this book now. 150 pages filled with stories from people who loved him. Who saw him. Who respected him. I hope this book helps them and you process his absence. While I always felt like I was at the center of his world, reading these memories has shown me how many others he made space for... how deeply he connected with so many.

So to everyone who shared a part of him with us - thank you. You've given me more of him than I thought I'd ever get back.

If there's one thing I hope you leave with, it's something he taught us just by being who he was... love freely, give generously, and don't wait to show up for the people who matter. This is how we keep Tony-ism alive, by acting it out, one quality at a time!

title: If You Have Two Friends in Your Lifetime, You're Lucky

content: Let me proudly say I had only one VERY GOOD FRIEND and I am ever grateful to God for that.... For anything and everything if there was a person whom one can trust, believe, have confidence, enjoy the company at any point of time, to me, it was no one else but TONY. I have many incidents to quote here. Sharing a few In Godrej we used to have monthly sales meetings at various locations viz.. Lucknow, Jaipur, Chandigarh etc.. Not even once we missed him in any of our house functions, get togethers, as to me he was part of my family. Even if he had a very busy schedule, he would drop in for a few minutes. title: Aapke Yahan Par AC Lagwa Dein?
author: Dr Rishi Pal Singh
content: बत्रा साहब को भुलाना तो मेरे ख्याल से नामुमकिन है। मेरी जो उनसे मुलाकात हुई थी, वह बहुत पुरानी है। 1989 में मुलाक़ात एक confrontation के साथ हुई थी। मैं बत्रा साहब के बिल्कुल पीछे रहता हूँ। मेरे कमरे की खिड़की, बत्रा साहब के कमरे की खिड़की के बिल्कुल सामने थी। तो बत्रा साहब ने उस खिड़की में AC लगवा लिया और उसकी गर्म हवा मेरे कमरे में जाती थी। थोड़े दिनों तक तो मैं चुप रहा, फिर एक दिन मेरी मिसेज़ ने कहा कि आप उनसे रिक्वेस्ट करो, क्या पता कुछ हल निकल जाए। मैंने कहा कि सीधा तो बात नहीं करूँगा, लेकिन मैं थूसू जी से बात कर सकता हूँ। थूसू जी, बत्रा जी के सामने रहते थे और आपस में काफ़ी मिलते-जुलते रहते थे। तो एक दिन मैं थूसू जी के पास गया और उनको अपनी समस्या बताई, तो उन्होंने कहा कि क्या AC टोनी ने लगवाया है? तो मैंने कहा कि बत्रा साहब ने, क्योंकि मुझे नहीं पता था कि उनका नाम टोनी है। हम दोनों उनके पास गए और भूसू जी ने घंटी बजाई। तो बत्रा जी निकल कर आए। थूसू जी ने कहा कि ये डॉक्टर साहब हैं और इनकी एक समस्या है। तो बोले, "आओ जी, क्या हुआ?" मैंने कहा कि आपके AC की गर्म हवा मेरे कमरे में जाती है और हमारा तो एक कमरा बेकार हो गया। तो वो एकदम से बोले, "एक AC आपके भी लगवा देता हूँ।" मैंने कहा, "मेरे को नहीं चाहिए। और पीछे धोबी भी है।" तो बोले, "सोच कर कुछ समाधान निकालते हैं।" दो दिन बाद बोले, "सर जी, यदि AC की डायरेक्शन बदल दूँ तो कैसा रहेगा?" मैंने कहा, "ठीक रहेगा।" और उन्होंने दूसरी खिड़की में लगवा लिया। उसके बाद वो मेरे दिल में बस गए और हम एक-दूसरे के बहुत करीब आ गए। एक इंसिडेंट और याद आ रही है जब मैंने उनसे कहा कि मुझे प्रिस्क्रिप्शन प्रिंट कराने हैं। तो बोले, "मैं जान-पहचान वालों का काम नहीं करता, क्योंकि उनसे पैसे मांगने में शर्म आती है।" तो मैंने कहा, "मैं तो एडवांस में पेमेंट करता हूँ।" तो बोले, "सैंपल दे देना, काम हो जाएगा।" और मैंने सैंपल दिया, तो प्रिंट करके ला दिए। पेमेंट के लिए बोलते थे, "कोई बात नहीं, ले लेंगे।" पर मैं उनको पेमेंट साथ के साथ कर देता था। अभी भी मेरे पास पेपर का इतना स्टॉक है कि जब तक क्लीनिक होगा, पेपर नहीं खरीदना पड़ेगा। अब तो हम एक-दूसरे को भाई समझते थे। मेरे लिए तो वो अभी भी मेरे दिल में हैं। शायद ज़िंदगी भर भुलाना मुश्किल है।

title: Sarvagun Sampann Mahamanav
author: Shree Shankar Swami
content: आदरणीय टोनी जी का जीवन एक महाकाव्य है। उनके जीवन काव्य की सुगंध वर्षों वर्ष आत्मीय जनों के हृदयों को महकाती रहेगी। दिवंगत टोनी जी हमारे आदर्श रहे हैं। भूतो न भविष्यति ना तो ऐसा सर्वगुण संपन्न महामानव कभी हमारे जीवन में आया और ना ही कोई संभावना है। वह एक और अकेले हैं जिन्होंने हर किसी के हृदय को जीता। जन जन के प्रति उनका कामना रहित निस्वार्थ प्रेम, हर रिश्ते में समर्पण और सहयोग, उनका परोपकारी और उदार हृदय, वंदनीय है। निश्चय ही वे परम पद के अधिकारी हैं। उनके जीवन काव्य का वर्णन करना मेरे लिए बड़ा ही दुष्कर और असहज है। कलम नहीं चलती, वाणी वर्णन नहीं कर पाती। उनके महात्म्य को समझने समझाने के लिए शब्द नहीं मिल रहे, निशब्द हूँ मैं, पर भावनाओं में उनके लिए शाश्वत प्रेम भरा है। जब कभी टोनी जी की मधुर पावन स्मृतियों को भुला पाता हूँ तो परमात्मा की याद आती है। और परमात्मा के सानिध्य में जब टोनी जी को देखता हूँ तो मन शांति पाने लगता है कि हे दिवंगत आत्मने, आप को हमारा शत शत प्रणाम प्रणाम प्रणाम।

title: Bhai Ki Yaadein
author: Vinod Gupta
content: टोनी भाई कभी-कभी चेहरा देखकर हाव-भाव समझ लेते थे। क्या बात, परेशान हैं? बिना बोले दिल की बातों को समझ लेना आता था भाई को। मेरे दोनों बेटे बहुत बार किसी भी सलाह के लिए भाई को बिना झिझक फोन कर लेते थे। भाई मेरे ऑफिस के आसपास से निकलते हुए फोन कर लेते थे ...कहाँ है? झप्पी मार के निकलना है। कहीं से निकलते समय फोन करते थे - समोसे खाएगा? यह खाएगा, वो खाएगा। जब ऑफिस आते थे, गाड़ी में बहुत सामान रखते थे - प्रसाद खाएगा... ले, फ्रूट्स रखे हैं... खाएगा? मंगल और शनि को बजे पाठ करना है। किसी का फोन नहीं उठाते थे पाठ के बीच में। मैं गलती से फोन कर लेता था तो बाद में कॉल ज़रूर आता था। Lots and lots of memories since always and for ever

title: Yaadein
author: Alka Singh
relationship: Principal, Air Force Golden Jubilee Institute
content:
I remember meeting Mr Tony in the corridors of AFGJI when JK Batra Sir was the Vice-Principal. I gently referred to him as 'Tony Sir' and Batra Sir in his loud baritone said-Don't call him Tony Sir, just call him Tony. But I also referred to him as Mr Tony or Tony Sir as he was elder to me.

It is hard to believe that he is not with us. I still think that one day he will get down from his car in front of AFGJI and hand me a packet of papers to go through and edit. The other day my nephew reminded me and said that Batra Sir has never come to our house, but Tony Sir came to our house once. It was summer vacation and the school magazine 'Swarnima' had to be edited and printed. So he came to our home in Mahavir Enclave all the way from Shalimar Bagh to hand me the packet of papers.

His dedication and commitment to his work is what I will always remember. He would often come to school with Question papers banners magazines etc. Our school has really had a long association with him and the entire family. He would generally come around 2 pm, meet the staff members with a lot of positivity and warmth.

For all of us, he will always be remembered as the smiling, frank religious, cheerful Tony Sir. It is difficult to think about him in the past tense. Farewell Tony Sir, till we meet on the other side.

title: "Ho Jayega Yaar!"
author: Brijesh
content:
Call him a contractor or a friend or an elder brother or a mentor, or use words that cannot describe our bond, this is my journey with Tony ji. I joined AFBBS in 1992. I met him first at Air Force Bal Bharti School... a cheerfully smiling personality who always used to say, "Ho jayega yaar." whenever any difficulty arose. The best of the best at Bal Bharti School introduced him to me as Tony ji.

In 1993, I joined TAFS, there I saw again, the same lovely contractor. He told me that he was dealing with all three AF schools. Till 2010, I knew him only as Tony ji- the contractor for printing and stationery who was printing all our jobs with utmost sincerity and maintained full confidentiality while printing question papers.

One day, I got a call from the security officer that Mr. Gajender Batra would like to visit the school, and I thought, who is this fellow? When he reached the school, I got to know that Tony's actual name is Mr. Gajender Batra - and the second shock was that he is the brother of the AFGJI principal. At that moment, my respect for him rose to even greater heights- for being someone who, despite being the real brother of the principal of the same organisation, had never taken any advantage in any sense.

Whenever he was visiting Salasar ji, I always received prasad from him and even had the opportunity to travel with him to Salasar ji. He was such a down-to-earth person who was always there to help everyone.

title: Gone from Sight, Forever in Souls
author: DN Chopra
content:
परमात्मा ने जन्म और मरण का समय तय किया हुआ है। बीच का कुछ समय ही मिलता है इंसान को अपने आप कुछ करने के लिए। उसमें वो दूसरों को सुख देता है या दुख देता है। जो भी कर्म हम करते हैं, वो हमारे भाग्य का निर्धारण करते हैं।

बत्रा मैडम के साथ मैंने बहुत शाखाओं में काम किया है और बहुत अच्छा अनुभव रहा है। बत्रा जी से भी वैसे तो दो-तीन बार बैंक में आते-जाते मुलाकात हुई, लेकिन उनके स्वभाव का ज्यादा अनुभव तब हुआ जब पिछले साल जनवरी में मैंने अपना जन्मदिन निरंकारी सरोवर, जो कि एक बहुत ही शांत और पवित्र खुला स्थान है, वहाँ अपने रिटायर्ड साथियों के साथ जनवरी की धूप का आनंद लेते हुए सेलिब्रेट करने का प्रोग्राम बनाया।

बत्रा जी हालांकि हमारे मेहमान थे, लेकिन उन्होंने वहाँ घर के एक सदस्य की तरह खुद ही सारी जिम्मेदारी संभाल ली। उन्होंने पूरे प्रोग्राम का वीडियो बनाया, फोटो खींचे और हमें भेजे। सबके साथ ऐसे घुल-मिल के बात कर रहे थे और उनके चेहरे पर हमेशा मुस्कराहट रहती थी। उनसे मिलके, बात करके बहुत अच्छा लगता था। मेरी बिटिया भी उनसे बहुत प्रभावित हुई और उनकी बहुत ही तारीफ करती है। इतनी इंसानियत के गुणों वाले आदमी मिलना मुश्किल है।

जाना तो सबको है, और वो चले गए। लेकिन अफ़सोस इस बात का है कि अचानक चले गए। क्या प्रभु ने कोई खेल रचा, पता नहीं। निराकार रूप में तो वो अब भी हमारे साथ हैं, पर उनका यूं चले जाना बड़ा अखर रहा है। मैं प्रभु से परिवार के लिए और बच्चों के लिए प्रार्थना करता हूँ कि बच्चे जीवन में आगे बढ़ते रहें, सुखी रहें, और परमात्मा का आशीर्वाद सब पर बना रहे। जय निरंकार।

title: श्रद्धा सुमन
author: Smt Raj Seth
content:
ज़िन्दगी यादों का सफ़र है। यहाँ अनगिनत लोगों से मुलाक़ात होती है। कुछ याद नहीं रहते और कुछ ऐसी अमित छाप छोड़ जाते हैं जिन्हें भुलाया नहीं जा सकता। स्वर्गीय टोनी जी ऐसी ही हस्ती थे।

मेरा परिचय उनसे पूनम बत्रा जी, जो मेरी बैंक सहकर्मी थी के द्वारा हुआ। कोरोना काल सन 2020 73 वर्ष की आयु में मुझे कुछ लिखने की ईश्वर प्रेरणा हुईं। कुछ कविताएँ लिखी जिसे पूनम बत्रा जी और टोनी जी ने पुस्तक रूप में प्रकाशित करने की प्रेरणा दी। घर बैठे-बैठे ही सारी सुविधाएँ उपलब्ध कराईं और मेरी तीन पुस्तकों के प्रकाशन में पूरा सहयोग दिया।

टोनी जी से मिलने का अवसर कभी नहीं मिला। फ़ोन पर ही बात होती। उनकी बातों में इतना अपनापन होता लगता मैं उन्हें बरसों से जानती हूँ। उनसे न मिल पाने का मलाल हमेशा रहेगा। वह इतनी जल्दी हम से बिछड़ जाएँगे ऐसा सोचा न था।

ऐसे लोगों की सूची में जिन्हें मैं अपनी स्मृतियों में हमेशा संजो के रखना चाहती हूँ उनका नाम शामिल रहेगा। ईश्वर उनकी आत्मा को शांति प्रदान करें और अपने श्री चरणों में स्थान दें। अपनी भावनाओं को व्यक्त करना ही मेरी उनके प्रति विनम्र श्रद्धांजलि है।

title: Gali ki Raunak
author: Smt. Saroj Julka
content:
Ten years ago, I moved to C-C Block, Shalimar Bagh. It was here that I met the head of the Batra family, Tony Bhai. He was truly a gem of a person, affectionate, humble, and friendly. Always ready to help anyone in need. I have never met someone like him. He had a heart of gold and was a genuinely kind soul.

I still remember the time I had fractured my foot and was alone at home. Tony Bhai immediately came and took me to the doctor. I can never forget that gesture. Everyone in our colony loved and respected him. He was the lifeline of our block.

There used to be so much hustle bustle and Raunak and voice of Ramayana patha used to vibrate. So much activity, now it feels sad. Raunak of our lane is gone with him. His Aura was so positive cheerful and happy. The whole gali misses him and his Salasar Prasad so much.

Jai Shree Ram Tony Bhai. I miss you a lot.

title: "AUR BETA, SAB THEEK?"
author: Abhishek Batra
content:
I have always wondered... and to this date I am not sure how Tony Chachu managed to remember everyone's birthdays, anniversaries, or anything special that happened or was happening in his near and dear ones' lives. I believe this extended beyond just the family, to his friends, extended circle, and anyone he cared for. And he would send the most amazing messages, videos, pictures to everyone... and it always felt like those were coming straight from his heart.

I think our bond was at its strongest during my college days. I was in Manipal, away from home. He would always call and check on me... "aur sab thik... kuch chaiye ho to bata dena :)" And guess what? I would call him every second month... "Chachu thode ... bhej do pls :)" And he would never miss...for anything!!

Another thing I fondly remember is the way Chachu used to respond to phone calls. He was always polite, happy... and within seconds, he would put the caller at ease... make them feel like they were the most important person for him that day :) Unintentionally, I think I have tried to take this habit from him in my personal life as well...

I guess his biggest strength was his love, for everyone and everything around him. He was always ensuring everybody was doing good... if they needed anything... he would help them out wherever, whenever Chachu wouldn't fulfil that... and you'd be like, "when did I say that I needed this :)" thank you for everything, Chachu! Love you, always!

title: "MY FIRST EVER BLACK LABEL BOTTLE CAME FROM..GUESS WHO?"
author: Akshay Batra
content:
The kind of relationship I shared with Tony papa has always been and will continue to be closest to my heart. There never was a "chacha-bhatija" relationship, it was always like a father-son bond that I shared and cherished. He was always there for all of us whenever we needed him. I remember since a small age, I've never seen him reach anywhere empty handed, there was always something or the other that he used to get for everyone.

Once, Papa was travelling and Tony papa had come specially from Shalimar Bagh to Mayur Vihar to take Dadaji to buy a pair of chappals because he wasn't listening to anyone and the only person whom he couldn't say no to was Tony papa. That is the kind of love and respect everyone (irrespective their age) had for him. He has always been the binding force of the family and I clearly say that whoever I know in my life, be it relatives, my friends, family friends, neighbours, extended family, even extended family's extended family know Tony Papa. That was the kind of charm and aura he had wherever he went.

My one and only trip to Salasar was everyone led by Tony Papa. Bas ek baar bolne ki der thi ki mujhe Salasar jana hai fir kya tha, the plan was made and we went. The kind of respect and love I saw in people for him- it was something else! Everyone knew him and best of best arrangements were made for us. That was a memorable trip!

And it might be hard to believe but the 1st ever Black Label bottle that I received as a gift was given by Tony Papa. I can never forget the kind of preparation stress I had before my wedding and Tony Papa said 'tu bas Dilli aaja, mein sab karwa dunga'. That was it and everything was sorted within no time. We all will always remember him with fondness, love and respect. And miss his presence around us always. But I'm sure, he always has an eye on us wherever he is.

title: THE UNFORGETTABLE EMBRACE: HONORING TONY MAMA
author: Amit Kaistha
content:
I vividly remember my first meeting with Tony Mama. Roop and I had just decided to get married our families met for the first time in the 1st week of February 2004, at Swagath restaurant in Defence Colony Market. Immediately, a message went out across the family channels (there was no WhatsApp back then), and as soon as we wrapped up dinner, Tony Mama and his crew Ashish, Abhishek, and Tarun arrived to meet us. It was close to midnight, and his first embrace and hug (a new experience for me personally) are still something I cherish.

As the months passed, leading up to our wedding in October, I would meet Tony Mama more and more. He was the quintessential go-to person for all the wedding arrangements in the family. At that time, I didn't know him as "Jagat Mama" - it was only later, as more family events unfolded, that I came to understand and appreciate his "Jagat" name. His world was the Family, and for the family, he was the link to the world who got everything done.

The gifts, at first, caused a bit of discomfort for me (and for Roop and me as a couple), but as we got to know each other better, we found a middle ground. Over time, an unspoken bond of mutual respect and affection formed between us.

His ability to connect with everyone - from the most senior family member to the youngest, from the rich to the poor was truly unique. He was always giving, always in service to others, whether it was his parents, siblings, the extended family, or his friends. There are countless qualities of his that stand out, qualities that are difficult for any of us to fully emulate.

I know this: I will miss the first call and message from him on my, Roop's, my parents', Ahaana's, and Aaradhya's birthdays and our anniversaries. I will long for his tight embrace and hug - now that it's gone, I understand what is meant by "pyaar ki jhappi". I will miss his thoughtful gifts (the last one he gave me was a T-shirt in September/October 2024, after his first surgery, insisting that I take it, saying, "Don't say no to this"). It's now my favorite, most treasured T-shirt.

I will no longer hear his voice during family weddings when he sang and every time I hear the word "chaubara" and the aloo bade karaare song, I will be reminded of him.

He has left an indelible mark on me. If I can be even a fraction of what he was to everyone around him, I will consider myself successful in life.

Adieu, dearest Tony Mama... you have left us far too soon, more quickly than any of us could have ever imagined. But in the time you shared with us, there are so many lessons and memories we will carry forward, emulating the kindness and love you showed to all of us.

title: "A WHOLESOME PERSON"
author: Anshuman Chawla
content:
Mamu was a father figure for me. The bond that I had with him grew over the years, and grew in different phases of my life.

In our childhood, I knew that no birthday celebration was complete without him. I remember all the fun things he made me do! One of which was betting with us to make us eat nice things! Like when there would be a few idlis left after dinner, he would challenge Tarun and me- "If you eat all the 5 idlis, I'll give you two thousand rupees"... or maybe he would say "Let's see who can finish first, all the remaining dhoklas! Jo pehle khatam karega usko 500 rupay inaam!" Same with gulab jamuns and pakoras and what not!! We connected on cricket, food and naughtiness... I used to not want to go back home. So much so that when Mummy and Papa came to get me back, I would go hide in the kitchen and Mummy would run after me..

When I made him meet Ankita, he was so happy that I am with someone who is in his neighbourhood and would always tease me to say that now you have to come to Shalimar Bagh double times.

He was my go-to person in so many ways. I will consider myself lucky if I can even be 10% of what he was to me and all my nieces and nephews.

title: "A HEART OF GOLD"
author: Anuj Saigal
content:
Tony Chachu was so many things rolled into one: a father-in-law, a friend, a guide - but above all, he was unconditional love in human form. His devotion, his humour, the zest with which he lived life, his love for food and for feeding others, his generosity... he had a heart of gold.

His words like "बेटा क्या खाएगा... कुछ मंगवाऊं" were always the first thing he would ask me every time I went to meet him. Now when I go to the house, I feel he will suddenly appear and say, "अनुज तू आ गया... आज ये खाते हैं।"

I think every moment spent with him brought out his qualities, whether it was an impromptu drop-in at the house or at a function. His never-ending zeal to do good and spread goodness and happiness and see everyone with a smile on his face, I would say is Tony-ism.

He has been like an angel sent from God to both Shweta and me, when we were trying for Aarohi and Ariana. Right from the trip to Salasar, to Amritsar, to also taking care of Shweta when she was carrying. Words are too less to describe how he has influenced us and made us what we are today.

Our relationship was always at its best, always in respect of him.

His loving, kind and thankful nature, with a strong mind to persuade anyone, was his biggest strength. He would go out of his way to make things easier for others, not worrying how it would affect him.

title: चाचू – हर रिश्ते में प्यार, हर मोड़ पर साथ
author: Ekta Batra Chopra
content:
ऐसे कई मौके हैं जब चाचू ने सिर्फ यह नहीं कहा कि "आकर ले जाओ," बल्कि हर चीज़ खुद फेंक करवाकर courier की, और फिर खुद उसका tracking करते रहते कि पहुंचा या नहीं, कहीं कुछ खराब तो नहीं हुआ। मैं उन्हें हर बार फ़ोटो भेजती, "चाचू, सब ठीक-ठाक पहुंच गया।"

जब भी वो हमारे घर आने वाले होते, तो उनका फोन आता, "क्या लाऊं?" मैं कहती, "कुछ मत लाना चाचू, बहुत कुछ बना हुआ है।" तो कहते, "अच्छा, सफेद ढोकला ले आऊं? मटर ले आऊं? सुमित को अच्छा लगेगा? या समोसे ले आता हूं?" मना करती रहती, तो फिर हम यही फाइनल करते कि, "चाचू, आप अपने आप ले आओ... बस quantity कम लाना!" लेकिन जब वो आते... तो बड़े-बड़े थैले भरकर प्यार लाते।

हमारा रिश्ता कुछ ऐसा बन गया था कि जो भी चाहिए, "चाचू से पूछ लो, contact तो मिल ही जाएगा!" बच्चों के birthday पर तो जैसे रिवाज़ सा बन गया था, return gift की help तो चाचू ही करेंगे। और सुमीत के साथ... सुमीत के पेरेंट्स के साथ.... चाचू ने ऐसा दिल का connection जोड़ लिया था कि उनका एक अलग ही संबंध बन गया था, जो सिर्फ मेरे ज़रिए नहीं था। वो अपनापन, वो भरोसा, वो चुपचाप बहता हुआ रिश्ता, अपने आप में बहुत ही खास था।

इशिका और चाचू का रिश्ता तो एक अलग ही स्तर पर था, एक silent connection! आँखों ही आँखों में सब कुछ कह-सुन लेना... जब भी मिलते, इशिका दौड़कर उनके पास जाती, और फिर दोनों की अपनी setting चलती रहती। आँखों-आँखों में बातें... बिना कुछ कहे सब समझ जाना, आज भी वो सीन मेरी आँखों के सामने ताज़ा है।

आप great थे, और great हैं, चाचू जी! जय श्री राम जय माता दी !

title: टोनी मामा - मेरा रिश्ता, मेरी यादें
author: Dr Manisha Sachdeva
content:
बचपन में टोनी मामा से मेरा रिश्ता थोड़ा धुंधला था। सब उन्हें "टोनी मामू" कहते थे, एकदम कूल वाला vibe था उनका बाकी cousins के साथ। लेकिन मैं उन्हें हमेशा "मामा जी" बोलती थी... डर से नहीं, बस एक respect था, एक दूरी भी शायद, जो समझ में तब नहीं आती थी।

2016 में जब पापा नहीं रहे, तभी से मामा से रिश्ता जैसे दोबारा से जुड़ने लगा। वो जब मुझे गले लगाते थे, वो टाइट हग, उसमें जैसे वो कहना चाहते थे, "मैं हूं बेटा, तू अकेली नहीं है।" उस hug में बहुत कुछ था, comfort, protection, belonging.

2021 के लॉकडाउन में मैं और मम्मी कुछ दिन मामा के घर रुके थे। इतने relaxed और fun-filled दिन थे- खाना, गेम्स, बातें और वो एक गेम मुझे आज भी याद है जहां सबको एक-दूसरे की कोई अच्छाई बोलनी थी। सुनकर हैरानी हुई कि हमारे घर के बड़े भी इतने genuinely एक-दूसरे के बारे में बोल सकते हैं। और फिर एहसास हुआ, हम लोग अक्सर अपनों की अच्छाइयां for granted ले लेते हैं।

Physiotherapy Day भी मेरे लिए और मामा के लिए बहुत special होता था। हर साल September में मेरे क्लिनिक में physiotherapy day होता है, और मामा वहां जैसे host बन जाते थे! कभी कुछ लेकर आते, कभी गेम्स करवा देते, कभी patients से बातें करने लगते, सबको involve कर लेते थे।

title: टोनी मामा, मेरा रिश्ता, मेरी यादें (continued)
author: Dr Manisha Sachdeva
content:
He loved making people happy. कभी-कभी इतना ज़्यादा कि खुद को over-stretch कर देते थे। And I feel... कुछ traits उनके मुझमें भी हैं, और बाकी उनकी बहन (मतलब मेरी मम्मी) ke आ गए हैं।

मेरी शादी के बाद जब राजन मामा जी से मिला, तो एक अलग ही connection बन गया था। Infact, मिलने से पहले ही Mamaji ने उससे phone पर बात शुरू कर दी थी! पहले थोड़ा unknown बन के message किया, फिर धीरे-धीरे रोज़ बात करने लगे, texting every day. मुझे लगता है राजन को भी उनके साथ कुछ अलग सा connection feel होता था।

September में जब वो बीमार पड़े, तब ऐसा लगा कि उन्होंने हमें emotionally prepare कर दिया था... धीरे-धीरे। और फिर वो चले गए। शायद इसलिए आज हम सब उनके बारे में इतना कुछ लिख पा रहे हैं, बिना हर रोज़ रोए। रोते हैं... अंदर से बहुत कुछ हिल जाता है, लेकिन उनके जाने के बाद एक अजीब सी presence बनी हुई है, sadness से ज़्यादा unseen साथ महसूस होता है।

Mamaji, आपने सब कुछ दिल से किया, और हमें सिखाया कि किसी भी रिश्ते को धीरे-धीरे कैसे गहराई दी जा सकती है। आप अब भी हमारे बीच हो, उन hugs में, उन gifts में, physiotherapy day के हर कोने में... और उस energy में, जो हर किसी के चेहरे पे मुस्कान ला देती थी।

title: "TO LIVE SELFLESSLY AND LOVE UNCONDITIONALLY"
author: Mukul Arora
content:
Tony Chachu was one of the most selfless and loving human beings I've ever known. He was always thinking about what more could we do to help others. If anyone was in any sort of difficulty, he would always, always be there. And he did all of this without any expectation from the other person whatsoever, which was really, really inspiring to see.

We've all grown up hearing phrases like: "Karm karo aur phal ki ichha mat rakho" "Neki kar dariya mein daal." They sound noble in theory but often feel impossible to live by. Tony Chachu showed us that it is very much possible. It's no surprise that he was the most popular family member.

One other quality I really admire about chachu was the way he lived in the moment, was so full of life and always had a smile on his face. When he was with kids, he would become a kid and engage with them at their level.

Tony Chachu showed us all how to live selflessly and love unconditionally. His legacy doesn't just live in our memories- it lives in the way he inspired us to be kinder, more present, and more generous. His spirit of giving, his zest for life, and his gift for bringing people together will continue to shine through in all of us. Tony Chachu will always hold a special place in my heart, and remembering him will forever remind me of the kind of human being I aspire to be.

title: MY VERY FOND MEMORIES OF TONY MAMAJI
author: Navita Sachdeva
content:
Some bonds go beyond words...deeply rooted in love, laughter, and understanding. Tony mamaji was one such presence in our life. A gentle guide, a source of wisdom, and often, the warmest comfort in the room.

I remember his infectious laugh, the way he made even the simplest moments feel special. Whether it was stories from his youth, thoughtful advice shared over tea, or just his reassuring presence during tough times, mamaji had a way of making everything better.

He taught us values without preaching, strength without harshness, and love without conditions. His legacy isn't just in the memories we carry, but in the way he shaped the goodness in our hearts.

Though he's not physically with us, I carry his smile, his kindness, and his teachings every single day.

Forever in my heart, Tony mamaji. Miss you. Jai Shree Ram.

title: "IT'S HONESTLY HARD TO EXPLAIN HIM IN WORDS...."
author: Rajan Sethi
content:
...He was one of those persons who could make everyone feel special, like you were the only one that mattered in that moment. And he did this so effortlessly, with so much love and warmth. I saw it with myself, with my parents... he just had this gift of making a place in people's hearts.

I didn't know Mamaji for a very long time. We got to know each other after I got married in 2022, but even in that short time, there were moments that really stayed with me. He would call randomly, sometimes just to check in, or show up out of nowhere with kachoris or something he picked up on the way. He'd click many photos during family get-togethers and send them later with sweet messages. Simple gestures but so full of love.

Even when he was in the hospital, fighting for his health, low on energy and strength, he still gave me a chocolate. I still think about that. Who does that? In a moment where most people are struggling just to get through, he was still thinking about others. And every time I remember that: I think, why did I eat that chocolate? I should've kept it with me. It wasn't just a sweet, it was a moment, a memory, a gesture of pure love.

Mamaji, you are missed. Thank you for all the love, the little moments, and just being you.

title: STORY TIME: MUKAISH KI SAREE
author: Roopshree C Kaistha
content:
It was 1995, the time of my school farewell, a truly special occasion. You all know how particular I've always been about dressing a certain way. I had a clear vision: I wanted to wear a peach-colored saree with silver mukaish work all over. That soft shimmer, that delicate elegance... it had to be just right.

I told Mumma about it, but she was unsure where to even begin. Still, we went from shop to shop, South Ex and a few other places, but nothing matched what I had in mind. Then, Mumma spoke to Mama. As soon as he heard about my saree hunt, he got excited and asked, "Kya chahiye? Kaisi chahiye?"

Mama took it upon himself like a mission. He brought back five different white sarees, each with a unique design. I still remember his taste and mine didn't always match. He kept suggesting, "Yeh wali le lo, yeh achhi lagegi," but I had already made up my mind. "No, Mamu, I want this one only," I said firmly, pointing to the one that stole my heart.

Then came the next step, dyeing it peach, exactly the shade I had dreamt of. He had it all done. I didn't have to run around anywhere, everything came to me, thanks to Mama. He did all the legwork so I could focus on my studies. He did the same process in so many other stages of our lives, when we got married, had kids - handled these little big sourcing assignments just so we would be at ease. May he rest in peace now.

title: MY ODE TO THE MAN WHO LOVED
author: Ruchika Chawla
content:
आ चल के तुझे, मैं ले के चलूं, एक ऐसे गगन के तले, जहां ग़म भी न हो, आंसू भी न हो, बस प्यार ही प्यार पले। - दूर गगन की छांव में (1964)

This song epitomizes my Mamu and what he stood for me. He taught me to love unconditionally and always with a smile.

He was my first port of call, because I knew he was always there for me, and more importantly, for the family. Whether it was the white dhokla he always got for me, or the special Bharat ke seviyan ki mithai, or the dark chocolate at the hospital, he remembered all my favourites (including him) and always made sure they were there.

He taught me to graciously accept love. He showered his love with gifts, hugs, and blessings. At first I used to tell him, "Rahne do Mamu," but he would not listen. So I accepted it, as all this was his way to love. He loved it when I made demands on him, and no matter what they were, all were taken care of with utmost love and care.

title: MY ODE TO THE MAN WHO LOVED (continued)
author: Ruchika Chawla
content:
Rakhi is a very special festival for me, and I think somewhere, he is the reason for it. He taught us what sibling love is, and what it means to stand with them no matter what.

On Rakhis, he loved that we all got together (always preferably in Shalimar Bagh if he had his way and his sisters didn't throw a tantrum), shared laughs, love, and food, together from morning to at least the evening, if not dinner.

The last Rakhi we celebrated together, he sat me down and gave me, from his wallet, a coin he had from Vaishno Devi. I don't know since when. That coin will always hold a special space in my heart and wallet :)

Mamu Jaan, thank you for everything that you did and stood for in life. I know you are there with us, somewhere in the door gagan ki chhaon mein, looking upon all of us, blessing us, and guiding us to create a world around us, jahan pyaar hi pyaar pale! Love you, always!

title: "AAJ HUM KATHA SUNATE HAIN... RAM NAHI, RAM BHAKT KI..."
author: Saryu Khanna
content:
एक ऐसा राम भक्त जो सिर्फ पूजा में नहीं, हर इंसान के चेहरे पे मुस्कान लाने में विश्वास रखता था। वो थे हमारे प्यारे Tony मामा जी।

उनके जैसे लोग भगवान हर बार नहीं बनाते। वो दिल के इतने साफ, इतने उदार, इतने प्यारे थे कि लगता है भगवान ने खुद चुन के भेजा था प्रेम बांटने के लिए, इंसानियत का पाठ पढ़ाने के लिए, और दुनिया को ये याद दिलाने के लिए कि: "Kindness keeps the world afloat."

मामा जी हर दिल का गीत थे, हर रिश्ते का गहरा रंग थे। उन्होंने कभी किसी का जन्मदिन नहीं भूला, हर तस्वीर को छांट छांट कर video बनाते, दो घंटे नहीं, पूरा दिल लगाते। उनके लिए हर रिश्ता एक इबादत था।

हमें उनकी यादों में रोना नहीं है, हमें उनकी बातों में जीना है, और हर दिन उनकी एक quality को अपनी ज़िंदगी में उतारना है - थोड़ा हंसना, थोड़ा बांटना, थोड़ा ममता देना। और जाते जाते, उन्हीं के अंदाज़ में - जैइइइइ राम जी की!

title: SEE YOU AGAIN!
author: Shreya Bhatia
content:
What a personality he was - I've never met anyone so warm, so giving. He had the biggest heart. That's something to truly learn from him. He was the kind of person no one could dislike. And somehow, he was never tired. His energy was always so positive, so full of life... it was something to aspire to.

Honestly, it still doesn't feel like Tony Uncle is gone. For me, he's still around. I hesitated meeting him in his final days. I wanted to remember him the way I've always known him. I prayed a lot.

He's on his onward journey now, but we mortals will miss him a lot. They say you experience true peace when you leave this world, that's what I wish for him. And they also say that people who are close find their way back to each other in another lifetime. I believe that too.

title: "MAIN HOON NA"
author: Shweta Batra Saigal
content:
All my life Tony Chachu has always, always been there. Good times or bad... the one constant who has always shown up for me... always providing a safe space when things got tough. And at the heart of all good times... he was there, smiling, joyful... standing with hands always overflowing with bags of food and gifts!!

His love for Bollywood and cricket was legendary!! From the time we watched the India-New Zealand semi-finals last year, where he organised the big TV and we all sat in the drawing room and watched the match (and we have done it loads of times)... to times when I was much, much younger and Chachu used to get the VCR and we used to watch हिंदी movies...

My favourite moment with Chachu was on my wedding day... he hugged me and said... "तू आराम से जा बेटा... मैं हूँ न..." These three words sum up my Chachu for me...

The time I spent with Chachu when I stayed with Chachu and Chachi while I was expecting Aarohi and Ariana... though it was a very stressful time as I had this constant fear of something going wrong... he was one person who constantly told me... "Everything will be OK... keep faith in God..."

"Jai Shree Ram," you'd always greet,
A voice both calm and true,
Now every time I hear those words,
I feel a part of you.

A heart of gold, so pure, so vast,
You lived to give, to care,
For your parents, children, near and far-
Your matatav was rare.
